data.title: Data Types
data.description: Data types in JavaScript are fundamental in determining how data can be stored and manipulated within a program. They provide a structure that helps the programming language understand what operations are possible with that data and how it should be handled. By defining data types such as numbers, strings or Booleans, JavaScript can optimize memory usage and operation execution, ensuring that interactions with data are predictable and efficient.

types.title: Primitive Types
types.description: These are the basic types of data:

items.title: String
items.description: A sequence of characters used to represent text. For example, 'Hello, World!'.

items.title: Number
items.description: Represents both integer and floating-point numbers. For example, 42 or 3.14. JavaScript uses double-precision floating-point format for numbers.

items.title: BigInt
items.description: An integer with arbitrary precision. Useful for very large numbers. For example, 9007199254740991n.

items.title: Boolean
items.description: Represents a logical entity and can have two values: true and false.

items.title: Undefined
items.description: A variable that has not been assigned a value has the value undefined.

items.title: Null
items.description: Denotes a null value. Used to represent a non-existent or invalid object or address.

items.title: Symbol
items.description: A unique and immutable primitive introduced in ES6, used as the key of an Object property.

types.title: Object Types
types.description: JavaScript allows you to create objects, which are collections of properties:

items.title: Object
items.description: The most basic structure for storing data in a key-value format. For example, { name: 'John', age: 30 }.

items.title: Array
items.description: A special kind of object used for storing ordered collections. For example, ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry'].

items.title: Function
items.description: A block of code designed to perform a particular task. Functions are objects too.

data.conclusion: Understanding data types is crucial for writing efficient and error-free JavaScript code. They form the backbone of any program, determining how data is stored, manipulated, and interacted with throughout the execution of the application.
